name: CSS page-break properties
description: Properties to control the way elements are broken across (printed) pages.

links.title: Latest fragmentation specification (includes column & region breaks)

notes.general: Not all mobile browsers offer print support; support listed for these is based on browser engine capability.

byNum.1: Supports the `page-break-*` alias from the CSS 2.1 specification, but not the `break-*` properties from the latest spec.
byNum.2: Partial support is due to not supporting `avoid` for `page-break-before` & `page-break-after` (only `page-break-inside`).
byNum.3: Treats the `left` and `right` values like `always` (as allowed by specification).
